problem.p: What will be the status of the snapshot until the snapshot is complete.
True or False: Automated backups are enabled by default for a new DB Instance.
While creating the snapshots using the command line tools, which command should I be using?

Typically, you want your application to check whether a request generated an error before you spend any time processing results. The easiest way to find out if an error occurred is to look for an __________ node in the response from the Amazon RDS API.
Can we attach an EBS volume to more than one EC2 instance at the same time?
What are the two permission types used by AWS?
Amazon RDS automated backups and DB Snapshots are currently supported for only the __________ storage engine
Disabling automated backups ______ disable the point-in-time recovery.

Out of the stripping options available for the EBS volumes, which one has the following disadvantage : ‘Doubles the amount of I/O required from the instance to EBS compared to RAID 0, because you’re mirroring all writes to a pair of volumes, limiting how much you can stripe.’ ?
What does a “Domain” refer to in Amazon SWF?

choicegroup.choice: A security group in which only tasks inside can communicate with each other
The DNS record for the Amazon SWF service

problem.p: EBS Snapshots occur _____
Fill in the blanks: The base URI for all requests for instance metadata is ___________
How many relational database engines does RDS currently support?

choicegroup.choice: Three: MySQL, Oracle and Microsoft SQL Server.
Five: MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Cassandra and SQLite.

problem.p: How can I change the security group membership for interfaces owned by other AWS, such as Elastic Load Balancing?

choicegroup.choice: By using the service specific console or API\CLI commands

problem.p: Can Amazon S3 uploads resume on failure or do they need to restart?

choicegroup.choice: You can resume them, if you flag the “resume on failure” option before uploading.

problem.p: Which of the following cannot be used in Amazon EC2 to control who has access to specific Amazon EC2 instances?
What is the maximum write throughput I can provision for a single Dynamic DB table?

choicegroup.choice: Dynamic DB is designed to scale without limits, but if you go beyond 10,000 you have to contact AWS first.

problem.p: Is creating a Read Replica of another Read Replica supported?
What does the following command do with respect to the Amazon EC2 security groups? ec2-revoke RevokeSecurityGroupIngress

choicegroup.choice: Removes one or more security groups from a rule.
Removes one or more security groups from an Amazon EC2 instance.
Removes one or more rules from a security group.
Removes a security group from our account.

problem.p: Can a ‘user’ be associated with multiple AWS accounts?
True or False: Manually created DB Snapshots are deleted after the DB Instance is deleted.
What does the AWS Storage Gateway provide?

choicegroup.choice: It allows to integrate on-premises IT environments with Cloud Storage.
A direct encrypted connection to Amazon S3.
It’s a backup solution that provides an on-premises Cloud storage.
It provides an encrypted SSL endpoint for backups in the Cloud.

problem.p: Typically, you want your application to check whether a request generated an error before you spend any time processing results. The easiest way to find out if an error occurred is to look for an _____________ node in the response from the Amazon RDS API.
What is the durability of S3 RRS?
Can I move a Reserved Instance from one Region to another?

choicegroup.choice: Only if they are moving into GovCloud
Only if they are moving to US East from another region

problem.p: Is Federated Storage Engine currently supported by Amazon RDS for MySQL?
What does specifying the mapping /dev/sdc=none when launching an instance do?

choicegroup.choice: Prevents /dev/sdc from attaching to the instance.

problem.p: What is Amazon Glacier?

choicegroup.choice: You mean Amazon “Iceberg”: it’s a low-cost storage service.
A security tool that allows to “freeze” an EBS volume and perform computer forensics on it.
A low-cost storage service that provides secure and durable storage for data archiving and backup.
It’s a security tool that allows to “freeze” an EC2 instance and perform computer forensics on it.

problem.p: Is there a limit to how many groups a user can be in?

choicegroup.choice: Yes for all users except root

problem.p: Fill in the blanks: _________ let you categorize your EC2 resources in different ways, for example, by purpose, owner, or environment.
